uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.sal.manager.impl

Class KnowledgeBaseManagerSparql

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.sal.manager.IntegratedComponent
      • uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.sal.manager.impl.KnowledgeBaseManagerSparql
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    iServeComponent, KnowledgeBaseManager

    public class KnowledgeBaseManagerSparql
extends IntegratedComponent
implements KnowledgeBaseManager
    This class is a parametric tool for crawling for RDF data. todo parameters: timeout, max allowed file size, max allowed files, number of threads, request throttling (global, per-host) todo add logging with ScutterVocab?
    Author:
    Carlos Pedrinaci (KMi - The Open University)

      • getUnreachableModels

        public Set<URI> getUnreachableModels()
        Obtains a set with all the models that have not been reachable at some point. These are models that should be loaded but could not possibly due to the model being temporarily unavailable of the link being broken.
        Specified by:
        getUnreachableModels in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Returns:
        the set of unreachable models

               com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
               boolean forceUpdate)
        Description copied from interface: KnowledgeBaseManager
        Uploads a model into the Knowledge Base Manager After successfully uploading a model, implementations of this method should raise a OntologyCreatedEvent
        Specified by:
        uploadModel in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        modelUri - URI of the model to upload
        model - the actual model to upload
        forceUpdate - if true the model will be updated even if already is there

      • deleteModel

        public boolean deleteModel(URI modelUri)
        Deletes a model from the Knowledge Base Manager After successfully deleting a model, implementations of this method should raise a OntologyDeletedEvent
        Specified by:
        deleteModel in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        modelUri - the URI of the model to remove
        Returns:
        true if it was correctly deleted, false otherwise.

      • listEquivalentClasses

        public Set<URI> listEquivalentClasses(URI classUri)
        Answers a List all of URIs of the classes that are known to be equivalent to this class. Equivalence may be asserted in the model (using, for example, owl:equivalentClass, or may be inferred by the reasoner attached to the model. Note that the OWL semantics entails that every class is equivalent to itself, so when using a reasoning model clients should expect that this class will appear as a member of its own equivalent classes.
        Specified by:
        listEquivalentClasses in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        classUri - the URI of the class for which to list the equivalent classes
        Returns:
        the List of equivalent classes

      • listSubClasses

        public Set<URI> listSubClasses(URI classUri,
                      boolean direct)
        Answers a List of all the URIs of the classes that are declared to be sub-classes of this class. Note: this is currently dependent on Sesame's specific property for direct subclasses
        Specified by:
        listSubClasses in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        classUri - the URI of the class for which to list the subclasses.
        direct - if true only the direct subclasses will be listed.
        Returns:
        the list of subclasses

      • listSuperClasses

        public Set<URI> listSuperClasses(URI classUri,
                        boolean direct)
        Answers a List of all the URIs of the classes that are declared to be super-classes of this class. Note: this is currently dependent on Sesame's specific property for direct subclasses
        Specified by:
        listSuperClasses in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        classUri - the URI of the class for which to list the super-classes.
        direct - if true only the direct super-classes will be listed.
        Returns:
        the list of super-classes

        Description copied from interface: KnowledgeBaseManager
        List all concepts managed by the KnowledgeBaseManager.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

                                                             URI sourceClass,
                                                             URI targetClass)
        Description copied from interface: KnowledgeBaseManager
        List concepts linked by a chain of properties.
        Specified by:
        listLinkedConcepts in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:

        sourceClass - class of the source concept (optional/nullable)
        targetClass - class of the target concept (optional/nullable)
        Returns:

      • handleServiceCreated

        public void handleServiceCreated(ServiceCreatedEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: KnowledgeBaseManager
        The upload of services gets automatically notified via the event bus. Every Knowledge Base Manager should process this event and ensure among other things, that all relevant ontologies are included in the Knowledge Base.
        Specified by:
        handleServiceCreated in interface KnowledgeBaseManager
        Parameters:
        event - the Service Created Event
